mainTopic.title: Anxiolytics and antidepressants
mainTopic.content_info: The lecture handouts come with a lot of detailed information that is sufficient to cover the whole topic

quizzes.question: What percentage of the population does depression affect and with what common presentation?
quizzes.goodAnswer: 5% : low mood, loss of energy, and disinterest in activities
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: 15% : low mood, loss of energy, and disinterest in activities
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: 20% : hypertension, weight gain, and chronic pain

quizzes.question: What hypothesis is the majority of current theories about the mechanism of depression based on?
According to the DSM-IV, the diagnosis of depression is made when 5 of the following symptoms are present during a 2 week period:
quizzes.goodAnswer: Depressed mood, diminished interest in activities, weight loss or weight gain, insomnia, loss of energy, psychomotor agitation/retardation, worthlessness/guilt, thoughts about death.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Inattention, hyperactivity, disinhibition, executive dysfunction, emotional dysregulation, impulsivity, impaired working memory
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Hallucinations, delusions, disorganized thinking and behavior, flat or inappropriate affect
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Problems with social communication and interaction, and restricted or repetitive behaviors or interests.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Episodes of mania and depression (low mood), distorted sense of well being or self confidence, unusually talkative, needing less sleep.

quizzes.question: What is required for the symptoms to be considered clinically significant in the diagnosis of depression?
quizzes.goodAnswer: They cause clinically significant distress or impairment in social, occupational, or other important areas of functioning.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: When the symptoms can be explained by the direct physiological effects of a substance or drug they are taking
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: A general medical condition such as hypothyroidism can be explained as the cause
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: They are better accounted for by bereavement.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: They are only related to sleep disturbance such as alterations in sleep schedule, decreased amount of sleep, or increased levels of stress impeding sleep.

quizzes.question: What have studies of postmortem brains revealed about the structural or neurochemical abnormalities in depression?
quizzes.goodAnswer: No consistent structural or neurochemical abnormalities
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Consistent neurochemical abnormalities in the brain
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Consistent structural abnormalities in the brain

quizzes.question: To diagnose depression, we must rule out the following possible causes of the depressive symptoms
quizzes.goodAnswer: Direct physiological effect of a substance (Drug or medication) or general medical condition (hypothyroidism) or bereavement
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Familial genetic predisposition to depression or difficult family conditions
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Difficult upbringing with socioeconomic and emotional turbulence
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Imaging abnormality of the brain or abnormal blood test results
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Sleep disturbance, loss of a job, or major life change in the past few weeks

subTopics.title: Classes of Antidepressants and Treatment of Depression

quizzes.question: What are the major classes of antidepressants?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Tricyclics and heterocyclics, SSRIs, bupropion, non selective MAO inhibitors, and non pharmacological therapy (ECT, Psychotherapy)
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Adrenergic blockers, angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitors ...and calcium channel blockers
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Anticholinergics, MAO-B inhibitors, and COMT inhibitors

quizzes.question: What is a common side effect of tricyclic antidepressants as a result of its anticholinergic action, and what is a lethal side effect in overdose?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Somnolence, dry mouth, and urinary retention; Cardiac conduction disturbances: because of this, great care must be taken when these drugs are prescribed for potentially suicidal patients.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Anxiety and tremor; Liver toxicity: all are primarily metabolized by the liver
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Weight gain and moon face; Kidney failure: because of this, great care must be taken when these drugs are prescribed for potentially suicidal patients.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Tricyclic antidepressants do not have an anticholinergic action; Severe gastrointestinal distress due to the biochemical half life
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Hyperactivity and lack of attention; Respiratory depression

quizzes.question: What is the mechanism of action of tricyclic and heterocyclic medications?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Blockage of the reuptake of serotonin and/or norepinephrine, with anticholinergic action in many of these drugs
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Blockage of GABA receptors, with anticholinergic action in many of these drugs
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Blockage of the reuptake of serotonin and/or norepinephrine, without any anticholinergic action
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Increased reuptake of serotonin and/or norepinephrine

quizzes.question: What is the therapeutic effect of MAOI due to and as a result, what is a serious adverse effect associated with MAOIs when combined with tyramine containing foods?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Enhancement of CNS amine levels, circulatory crisis due to the accumulation of amines
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Blockage of serotonin reuptake, serotonin syndrome due to serotonin accumulation
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Enhancement of dopamine reuptake, tardive dyskinesia
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Decreased norepinephrine turnover, hyperglycemia due to inability of cells to reuptake glucose.

quizzes.question: Which class of antidepressants requires careful control to prevent serious adverse effects in real-world use?
Which antidepressant class acts by inhibition of presynaptic reuptake of serotonin in central synapses and what are the most common potential adverse effect of the drug class?
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: MAOi, severe sedation and weight gain
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Benzodiazepine, cardiac arrhythmias and pulmonological sequelae

quizzes.question: What are the most common tricyclic/heterocyclic medications used in the treatment of depression?
Bupropion is not sedating or anticholinergic, but can sometimes induce which symptoms?
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Somnolence, dry mouth, and urinary retention

quizzes.question: What are some examples of SSRI medications?
What antidepressant drug is also effective in treating tobacco addiction?
What method is often used to treat severely depressed patients because it can produce rapid improvement as opposed to drugs, which need time to take effect?
Because of the unpredictable response of each patient to particular antidepressants, we should do...
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Electroconvulsive therapy to start off treatment in all cases
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: A combination of all the available drugs
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Self treatment with over the counter medication
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Immediate clinical improvement upon therapy initiation

quizzes.question: What is the primary toxicity concern associated with benzodiazepines?
What drug is a benzodiazepine antagonist that blocks the effects of other benzodiazepines?
What channel does benzodiazepine act on and what is the mechanism of action?
quizzes.goodAnswer: GABA, Increases the frequency of channel opening
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: GABA, increasing the duration of channel opening
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Potassium, changes the conductance of the receptors

quizzes.question: After chronic usage of benzodiazepines, especially short half life agents... what is a concern with withdrawal?
Benzodiazepines are categorized from midazolam to flurazepam, distinguished primarily by their profiles of what?
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Typical application of the drug and half life

quizzes.question: What is the mechanism of action of barbiturates on GABA receptors?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Increase the duration of channel opening
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Increase the frequency of channel opening
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Change the conductance of the receptor

quizzes.question: What is a major toxicity concern associated with barbiturates, especially in overdose, which makes it potentially lethal?
Which of the following is an effect of both chronic use of benzodiazepines and barbiturates?
Which type of sedative is typically used for anxiolytic purposes?
Which type of sedative is typically used for hypnotic purposes?
For sedative use in surgical procedures, you should give a mixture of...
quizzes.goodAnswer: A short acting benzodiazepine and a short acting barbiturate, IV
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: A short acting benzodiazepine and a long acting barbiturate, IM
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: You don't need to give a mixture, it's either benzodiazepine or barbiturate alone, IV
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: A long acting benzodiazepine and a long acting barbiturate, IV
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: A long acting benzodiazepine and a long acting barbiturate, IM

subTopics.title: Tolerance, cross tolerance, and addiction to sedative drugs

quizzes.question: Chronic use of sedatives like benzodiazepines and barbiturates induces tolerance to which of the following?
quizzes.goodAnswer: To all members of the sedative class used, and cross tolerance to members of the other class
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: No effect on the members of the sedative class used, and cross tolerance to members of the other class
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: To all members of the sedative class used, and no effect on the members of the other class
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: No effect on the members of the sedative class used or cross tolerance to members of the other class
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Effect depends on the patient's liver function and metabolic rate

quizzes.question: What effect do both benzodiazepines and barbiturates have on ethanol tolerance?
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Have no effect on ethanol tolerance
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Enhances the effect of ethanol without changing the tolerance
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Benzodiazepines induce tolerance, while barbiturates do not
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Benzodiazepines do not induce tolerance, while barbiturates induce tolerance

quizzes.question: What are the most common side effects of rapid withdrawal from benzodiazepines or barbiturates?
